Articles.Content: How will the CG marker work? Will there be one for when the ship is full? When it is empty? Somewhere in between? Will there be one for full and one for empty?

At a guess, I'd say it only shows when actually in the VAB/SPH, and would not be able to be simulated in-flight when fuel's running out and such. Once you know where fuel's being drained from and which tanks will empty first, you can compensate for fuel loss using the initial CG marker as an accurate guide.
Attach the engines so they draw from the middle tank, and the fuel will get drawn from the outer tanks in, maximizing balance throughout the fuel load envelope. You can already do this in .16.
Sorry to be a noob. How do you let it drain the middle one last. Putting fuel lines inward like this []-->[]-->[]<--[]<--[] ?
Well, you're on he test team. You're going to know before all of us. And Puddinsky, yes that is correct.
